title: Uh yea if Riven can have dashes with 5 seconds cooldowns
body: Can Garen get his Q cooldown to start as soon as he casts it? Like seriously fuck Riven.

replies.body: I think he is saying how rivens q cd starts on the 1st q cast, but garens q wont even start ticking down in cd when he starts it, only when he auto attacks someone

Supposedly, it's to prevent you from double-q, since the buff duration is rather long. 

Same with things like Talon Q, wukong Q, etc.
Honestly what's wrong with that though? Rewards Garen for striking with his Q... decisively... hehe.

Because people considered Silencer anti-fun...

Silencer can now silence you for 23 seconds with one item in DotA, and if Garen can double-Q, he would be able to fill that role: double-silence you for 5 seconds, which is the new longest soft CC in the game (after Riot destroyed Zilean's E, of course).
I suppose they can add a timer to the silence (can't happen twice in x seconds) but the extra damage keeps being applied
Yeah it could work similar to {{champion:9}} E, the second Q could damage but not apply the silence, giving him the ability to get in some burst trades by using the auto attack reset after the Q
yeah the garen will Q, wait a bit, then go, auto and q again gaining 2 empowered attacks and a basic one, before spinning. That would be scary xD

Because it has a silence tied to it.
If OP had his way, Garen could activate Q, Wait up to 4.5 second to then silence for 2.5 seconds and then re-silence for another 2.5 seconds 1 second later.
Now had a teeny bit of cdr, and Garen can silence you for 5 consecutive seconds.

That's why.

Wait... What does that have to do with what I said? I think you might have misread.

Edit: In case this makes things more confusing, I'll reiterate and say that I was basically saying that the immunity time being 10 seconds is a bit long and can be shortened.

What I was saying that certain abilities that have a short cooldown (Rek'Sai burrow, Yasuo dash, Udyr bear persistent stance, etc) have a little circle timer that gives the enemy unit immunity to that ability's CC for a certain amount of time. If the immunity time (10 seconds) is too long, just have that time shortened based on the ability's level.
This is the same with Yasuo's dash, so the Garen silence immunity can have the same thing, allowing him to get multiple targets and maybe be very useful, seeing as he can tank a ton of damage, Demacia away and heal himself back up while standing in a bush in relative safety, then return to the fight.

Hope this^ clears things up.
Mmm not at all! Haha. From what I see you're saying the same thing I am. Are you saying the same thing I am? I don't know. I'm confused.

What you said was that the enemy is silenced for 2.5 seconds, then since Garen could potentially "stack" his Q strikes, they would be immune to his silence for 2.5 seconds afterwards, equaling 5 seconds of total immunity from the start of being silenced.
What I simply added, was that the silence immune time could stay at 10 seconds, but potentially decrease when you level up the Q, so that at the end the total immune time would be 6 seconds, or something like that.

What the original person said is that it wouldn't be good to have his Q strikes stack on top of one another because of the silence, and I added on to what you said about the 5 second immunity time, with having the immune time decrease, that way Garen wouldn't be able to continuously chunk and silence you at level 1...
Can't allow Garen to always have {{champion:86}} teed first bloods.

As a Garen main.

This is EXACTLY the same as Riven activating Q, using it, using it, then using the third knockback, starting a new Q while she stuns, then knocking back again.

Riven can lock you out of auto attacks for like 3 seconds if she does it properly.

This is all wrong sorry. If someone does this to you, we need to talk play styles here, Riven has a combo universal one , Q>AA>Q>AA>Q>AA this makes it so she utilizes each stack of her passive. This combo is done quick which immediately puts the cool down at5+ seconds early game and even late game as well. Riven CANNOT  so this infinite knock up stun combo you speak of and I'll tell you why: Each time riven Q she has a timer until she can use her next Q. This timer never changes. If the timer runs out and she does not Q I'm second or third time it will be put on a LONGER cool down. There is a way however to use all 3 Q's and once finished have it on a 2 second cool down or something near 2. Either way it's short. You Q WAIT more than 1 second until your q timer is almost done then you q again wait once more for a bit until it's ALMOST done then q a third time and the Broken Wings will be put on a short cool down. Here's the thing if you let a riven do this to you, your afk 99%. The amount of time this takes leaves you with more than 5-7 seconds to cc her run do anything to avoid this. Riven has to WAIT more than a second to activate her second and third q cast and try to hit an auto so this means you have two chances to do something to stop this "infinite combo" of her stunning and knocking up. You know what that is? Run back. If you run out her AA range she will be forced to waste her q to catch up then when it's on a longer cool down and she has nothing left but W to stun she has no other attacking abilities so chances are she runs away. She can't lock you out for 3 seconds also cause rivens W has a animation time by the time she finishes casting it without her e you'll be out of it only taking one auto. Riven e then w to use the stun faster by canceling it with her dash if you know this then you now know riven has room for counter play. This is not the same thing as garen being able to Silence twice in a row locking someone out of 5seconds WHILE having other abilities to use the two abilities and champs don't deserve comparison

Simple fix is reduce the SIlence duration but honestly if Riven can have a AOE stun and a AOE knockup and an AD scaling shield on a sub 9 second cooldown and with a measly 20 percent CDR can keep them all up damn near continuously i fail to see the problem.

They should either remove the shield, change it to scale off AP, or change the AD scaling and/or numbers on all her abilities.
As much fun as Riven was when I first played her in a bot match, I think she needs some number changes, because she can be almost full AD, have some defense, and still have enough CC to kill 3 people on her own, and then escape almost unharmed.
Similar to LB without the defense stuff

why would they scale it off AP when she only uses AD that would make her useless in every aspect. You guys are comparing 1 ability vs 1 ability, in my opinion use kit vs kit. And also for others saying that GAren < Riven as a riven main Garen > Riven i feel like most people just play recklessly. For riven to have the "infinite q combo" i heard someone say, she needs to time the qs for a bit. So q wait q wait q, and even then the cooldown is 2 seconds which is enough for counterplay since knock up isnt long, any hard cc shuts riven down her shield is not a big problem tbh it doesnt last very long if anything i guess you could reduce the shiled duration but riven has recived nerfs on nerfs on nerfs i feel as if shes fine the way she is now her kit is very nice but it can easily be counter by tankier champs and any hard cc, people mostly choose other burst champs to try to "outburst" her when this is not the way to go.

Besides the fact that she can knock you up, then stun you when you land, then dash and shield herself, doesn't really sound fun when she starts roaming to pick up kills.
What I'm saying with the shield scaling off AP, is that it wouldn't allow her to be able to absorb tons of damage while still dealing tons of damage.
That's why. To me it seems like an issue with Riven being an assassin but still having enough CC and gapclosers to not have to worry about anything.
Unless we not give her scaling on her stun or shield, then that would be better.
What do you think should be done if she eventually gets out of hand?

hm i see the point but riven has a few animation issues. a w is almost NEVER used on its own as by the time she finishes the animation, you are OUT of the stun its not even a second long. Here is where you need to learn the champ. Rivens go for a q, aa , q ,aa combo between those two Q's you have ample time to cc her and interrupt her combo and put her q on a longer cooldown. also going back to the e>w combo, this basically cancels her w animation which means after a knockup, she either dashes OUT and stuns or to the behind you and stuns, her shield absorbs damage but doesnt stop cc, if you cc her and force a cooldown on the shield, she can easily be countered. i know these things from experience, for example {{champion:54}} baits out e, the cheese wheels her for his gap closes, then he can easily just hit her down from there. A lot of people try to counter riven with head on bursts, not gonna work a majority of the time. Her main shutdown is CC and there are plenty of top lane champs that have slow stuns or silences. Her other is just tanks, tanks tanks tanks, dont try to outburst her. List of champs that give her issues

But yes, I understand what you mean, I think the hate for Riven comes into place because of if she gets a kill early, then no one helps their top laner when Riven comes back, then Riven will get fed pretty easily and then become an unstoppable target, because I've seen some annoying cases where there are champions who are powerful as heck, but are too tanky to be taken down first, so it comes to the point of "WTH, seriously?!"...
And I have seen some characters have some AP scaling when it is honestly better to be AD, but it all comes down to what happens in the match.
